title: E field at top of triangle

content.question: A point charge of <math alttext="negative q" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>−</mo><mi>q</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is located at <math alttext="the point x comma 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>,</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, and a point charge of <math alttext="positive q " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>+</mo><mi>q</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is located at <math alttext="the point negative x comma 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mo>−</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>,</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, as shown. What are the magnitude and direction of the electric field created by these point charges at the point <math alttext="the point 0 comma y" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>,</mo><mi>y</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, which is a distance <math alttext="r" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>r</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> from each point charge?
